intro: Hazardia ferrisiae, commonly known as the desert aster, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its gray-green, woolly foliage and produces showy, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems. Hazardia ferrisiae plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is an important part of the native flora in its habitat.
